subject: Regulator blocks Telecom Italia (TIT IM) spin off of network assets
Israel Military confirms it is currently striking Iranian Quds target in Syria and warns Syria not to harm Israeli territory or forces
Lixil Group (5938 JT) reports note Co. shares trading has been suspended by Tokyo Stock Exchange amid tender offer
Syrian air defenses reportedly shoot down several hostile targets according to SANA, while separate reports note Israel is currently attacking Iran Qud Force targets in Syria
PRE-MARKET JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: Japan Tobacco (2914 JT) December cigarette sales volumes fell 15.1% Y/Y to 6.8bln
content:
JAPAN

Japan Tobacco (2914 JT)
- Co. December cigarette sales volumes fell 15.1% Y/Y to 6.8bln. (Newswires)

Lixil Group (5938 JT)
- Co. CEO is said to be examining relocation to Singapore. (Nikkei)

Nissan (7201 JT)
- France is said to favour a merger between Nissan and Renault (RNO FP), although there were also reports that French Finance Minister Le Maire downplayed merger prospects. (Newswires)

Panasonic (6752 JT)
- Co. and Toyota (7201 JT) are planning to set up a JV to manufacture electric vehicle batteries. (Nikkei)

Shimizu (1803 JT)
- Co. received partial ban for 120 days on private-sector building contracts following guilty verdict related to anti-trust practices. (Newswires)

Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group (8316 JT)
- Co. reportedly ordered 65 planes from Airbus (AIR FP) for its leasing business. (Nikkei)


 

SOUTH KOREA

Property
- The government will unveil more measures to curb housing prices if required, according to the chief policy adviser to President Moon. (Yonhap)

Other News
- White House said US President Trump is planning a second summit with North Korea at the end of February, while it added that the US continues to make progress with North Korea and that sanctions are to remain. In related news, US State Department said Secretary of State Pompeo and Special Representative Biegun "had a good discussion" with the North Korean Envoy on efforts for progress on commitments made at the Singapore summit. (Newswires)
- China was said to begin anti-dumping probe on polysilicon from US and South Korea. (Newswires)
- South Korea's state-run pension fund suffered valuation losses from its investment in the country's 10 major conglomerates due to declines in their stocks, with value of holdings in the 10 conglomerates falling to KRW 66.45tln in 2018 from KRW 80.8tln in 2017. (Yonhap)

subject: Reports note markets are pricing around a 50% chance RBNZ will cut rates by year-end
EU is reportedly split regarding how long UK should delay Brexit with some governments said to be calling for an extension of as long as a year, while some are against any extension
PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN STOCK NEWS: Ausdrill (ASL AT) received 4 mining services contracts valued at AUD 171mln
content:
Ausdrill (ASL AT)
- Co. received 4 mining services contracts valued at AUD 171mln. (Newswires)

Healthscope (HSO AT)
- Co. is said to have not received a binding offer from Brookfield although is expected on January 22nd at the soonest. (AFR)

Sandfire Resources (SFR AT)
- Co. confirms non-binding offer for MOD Resources (MOD AT) after reports noted the Co. made a non-binding and conditional bid valued at AUD 0.37/Shr vs. last close of AUD 0.22/Shr. (Newswires)

Sims Metal Management (SGM AT)
- Co. guides H1 underlying EBIT around AUD 110mln, while it stated that H1 has been challenging for recycling companies globally which will continue in the near future. (Newswires)

Sydney Airport (SYD AT)
- Co. December traffic fell 0.1% Y/Y. (Newswires)

Telstra (TLS AT)
- Co. rolls out major upgrade to Asia-Pac network services. (Newswires)

Financials
- Corporate regulator ASIC is reportedly concerned that the banking royal commission could spur a period of legal battles against Australian banks which may ultimately backfire. (AFR)

Energy
- WTI crude futures rose over 3% to above USD 53.00/bbl. (Newswires)

subject: Moody's says Australian states are feeling pressure from housing correction
US President Trump and Turkey President Erdogan discussed expanding bilateral trade, according to the White House
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights include Chinese GDP, Industrial Production and Retail Sales; US and Malaysia holidays
ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA-PAC

China is reportedly to offer a path to eliminate US trade imbalance, according to sources which suggested that China is to offer a 6-year import boost exceeding USD 1tln, although US trade negotiators are said to be sceptical of the offer. (Newswires)

US President Trump stated there was a recent false report about lifting China tariffs, while he added trade talks are going well and a trade deal with China could very well happen. In separate news, it was also reported over the weekend that US President Trump’s Administration is said to be preparing an executive order that would restrict Chinese telecoms from operating in US. (Newswires)


UK/EU

UK PM May held a conference call with the Cabinet to renew efforts to find acceptable changes to the backstop arrangement. However, the conversation was said to be light on specifics and a source also stated there were "no actual solutions" proposed during the call. (Guardian)

UK PM May is reportedly considering amending Good Friday Agreement after failing again at attempt to negotiate a cross-party deal to break the Brexit deadlock. (Daily Telegraph)

UK Retail Sales (Dec) Y/Y 3.0% vs. Exp. 3.6% (Prev. 3.6%, Rev. 3.4%). (Newswires)

Fitch affirmed Austria at 'AA+'; outlook Positive and affirmed France at 'AA'; outlook stable, while S&P affirmed Grece at B+; outlook positive. (Newswires)


COMMODITIES

Baker Hughes Rig Count (18/Jan): oil rigs down 21 at 852, nat gas down 4 at 198, total down 25 at 1050 (prev. 1075). (Newswires)

GEOPOLITICS

White House said US President Trump is planning a second summit with North Korea at the end of February, while it added that the US continues to make progress with North Korea and that sanctions are to remain. In related news, US State Department said Secretary of State Pompeo and Special Representative Biegun "had a good discussion" with the North Korean Envoy on efforts for progress on commitments made at the Singapore summit. (Newswires)

US

US President Trump reportedly made an offer on the shut down over the weekend that would provide “Dreamers” and Temporary Protection Status visa holders protection to stay in US for another 3 years in exchange for funding the Border Wall, although this was said to have been rejected by the Democrats. (Newswires)

US Special Counsel Mueller’s office said reports that alleged document showed President Trump told former lawyer Cohen to lie are not accurate. (Newswires)

Fed's Williams (Voter, Hawkish) said they will reassess balance sheet policy if conditions change, while he added that tail winds have lost gust and rates are closer to normal. Furthermore, Williams commented that the Fed needs prudence, patience and good judgement. (Newswires)

Fed's Daly (Non-Voter, Dovish) is reportedly leaning towards pausing on interest rate hikes for a while. (Washington Post)

Fed's Harker (Non-Voter, Dovish) said US economy is doing well overall and that employers need to think creatively to combat workforce gaps in a tight labour market. (Newswires)

US Industrial Production (Dec) M/M 0.3% vs. Exp. 0.2% (Prev. 0.6%, Rev. 0.4%). (Newswires)


MARKET RECAP

Netflix (NFLX) was the first FAANG stock to report for the quarter, where it disappointed investors on revenue expectations, domestic subscriber additions as well as reporting a deepened negative FCF. Semiconductors (MU, AMAT, NVDA) outperformed, helped by reports China is to ramp up US imports; other trade sensitive stocks Caterpillar (CAT) and Boeing (BA) also benefitted. Apple (AAPL) moved higher with market even though its largest supplier Foxconn was reported to have cut 50,000 jobs due to faltering iPhone demand. Schlumberger (SLB) outperformed after beating revenue estimates. VF Corp (VFC) surged after beating top and bottom line estimates; American Express (AXP) underperformed after missing them. Tesla (TSLA) nosedived on the back of Musk announcing a 7% cut in its total staff. Eli Lilly (LLY) dragged down healthcare after unsuccessful results from a Phase 3 drug trial. SPX +1.36% at 2672, NASDAQ +0.98% at 6785, DJI +1.41% at 24713.

Investors moved away from treasuries on Friday as sentiment improved on hopes that US and China are making progress in talks. Solid manufacturing output also placed downward pressure on the complex. Most of the action was concentrated in the front end of the curve where yields were higher by c.5 bps at settlement. The yield curve saw some modest bear flattening heading into the long weekend as US markets will remain closed on Monday. US T-note futures (H9) settled 11 ticks lower at 121-05+.
